newsitem.title: INDIA: India agency to release wheat, rice to check price.
newsitem.headline: India agency to release wheat, rice to check price.

text.p: India's grain procurement agency will release 399,000 tonnes of wheat and 150,000 tonnes of rice for open sales in September to control prices, the agency said in a statement on Wednesday.
The state-owned Food Corporation of India (FCI) said it had been authorised by the government to intervene in the market to "reverse the inflationary trends in the price of wheat and rice."
"The corporation will be releasing 399,000 tonnes of wheat and 150,000 tonnes of rice to the open market during September, 1996," FCI said.
The agency said it would continue to monitor the price trends in the open market for both commodities and intervene when necessary.
